description: Learn Bloom's Taxonomy: Levels of Thinking in one minute.

hook.text: Benjamin Bloom ranked thinking into six levels. Most school tests only reach level two. The hard stuff starts at level

buildup.text: Bloom's six levels: remember, understand, apply, analyze, evaluate, create. Each level demands more cognitive

twist.text: 85% of teacher questions test only recall and comprehension. Schools rarely push students into analysis, evaluation, or

punchline.text: If your test only asks 'what,' you're only testing the bottom of thinking.
